you're revert warring already got one article locked. You are yet to use the talkpage on this one to disscuss changes on this one.
Talat Pasha is the man who masterminded the deportations, so I bet he knew the details of what he was doing - perhaps even more so than any "historian" who "narrated" it (history is a narration)
Talat Pasha is not reliable since he is no scholarly figure. Marashlians 1.2 estimate is not the only one
Talat Pasha's estimate of 300,000 is a well known fact, it's also mentioned in the article. On the other hand, it was not "over" 1.5 million. Even Marashlian says maximum 1.2 million.
What about third party sources? the source doesn't mention 300,000
1. It's not "over" 1.5 million. 2. Wikipedia's duty is to list facts, not to take sides. Talat Pasha's claim of 300,000 is valid as a "fact" as much as the Armenian government's claim of 1.5 million.
There is no exact number on any mass killing or genocide 300,000 is a Turkish view, and the estimates vary more than 1.5 mill
/* Armenian deaths, 1914 to 1918 */ Entirely from the Britannica article, not my personal opinion.
/* Armenian deaths, 1914 to 1918 */ The top paragraph is entirely from Britannica's website, including the Toynbee-McCarthy comparison (see the link). The bottom paragraph is by Anatolmethanol.
1. All figures are estimations, since there has never been an official death count. 2. If the uppermost estimation figure is given, then the lowermost estimation figure should also be given.

i think it's a problem to give a specific ceiling but not a specific basement, as per number of dead
assume good faith and stop the personal attacks. also stop edit waring and reach a consens in the talk page, before making anymore changes. I changed the envoy to an intelligence officer.
1. See the Talk section. 2. Arnold J. Toynbee was an "intelligence officer", and not an "envoy" (diplomat). So when you revert my edits with national pride, make sure you don't erase other stuff.
please discuss you edits in the talk page
That sentance is sourced and the numbers reflect that source. Please see the talkpage
1. All figures are estimations, since there has never been an official death count. 2. If the uppermost estimation figure is given, then the lowermost estimation figure should also be given.
The lead sentance is not the place to show and argue about Turkeys or Armenias position
You only "blurred" the facts and numbers: This is more specific, and directly to the point.
there were about 80 words in this sentence, literally. i think it's best that any edits to the opening be discussed on the talk page first
/* Casualties, 1914 to 1918 */ Toynbee estimates that of 1,800,000 Armenians, 600,000 died, 600,000 survived in exile, and 600,000 others managed to hide.

rv; the lead does not say it is the first genocide, it says 'one' of the first genocides. The herero genocide has no place in the lead, reserved to generally sum up the article (Armenian Genocide).
added a reference, of course it is relevant, you can't claim a genocide is the 'first' without information about an earlier genocide, both share many similarities
/* The status of the Ottoman Armenians */ removed fact tag
/* The status of the Ottoman Armenians */
Revert: this article is about the Armenian Genocide, not about any other genocide. The Herero and Namaqua Genocide is barely relevant at best, and certainly not relevant enough for the lead
Why diminish the genocide of the herero? It is directly relevant when you say which is the 'first genocide'
not directly relevent, please discuss changes prior to adding
the UN Whitaker report concluded the herero genocide was the "one of the earliest attempts at genocide in the 20th century"
